item.title: Generating Graphs Using HRGs
item.description: Developed and evaluated a new approach that learns the building blocks of graphs that can be used to understand and generate new realistic graphs.

item.title: Latent-Variable Probabilistic Graph Grammars
item.description: Adding latent variables to an HRG model, trained using Expectation-Maximization, generates graphs that generalize better to test data.

item.title: Infinity Mirror Test
item.description: We introduce the infinity mirror test for the analysis of graph generator performance and robustness when working with empirical networks.

item.title: Principled Structure Extraction as a Model for Network Growth
item.description: Salvador Aguinaga, Corey Pennycuff and Tim Weninger, NetSci Conference, Indianapolis, IN, June 21-23, 2017. (Poster)

item.title: CatPath: navigating concept graphs
item.description: What is the concept net or category hierarchy we navigate to connect different ideas together?

item.title: NLP ML with Spacy and Scikit-learn
Graph contraction
item.description: Graph algorithms that contract graphs according to a specific feature. This is similar to dimensionality reduction. These type of algorithms lend themselves to parallelization.

item.title: Feature Vectors from Graphs
item.description: Examine well known methods of extracting and feature vectors from graphs.

item.title: Neural Network Architectures
item.description: This projects aims to examine the complexity of neural network architectures to leverage structure that improves the training phase.

item.title: Modularity
item.description: In graph mining the concept of dividing the nodes of a network into groups or communities as part of a clustering exercise is also called modularity. How well graph generators preserve modularity?

item.title: openACC (My Notes)
item.description:
Parallelize Your Code

  • Benefits:
    • No involvement of OpenCL, CUDA, etc.
    • Source can work on both CPUs (serially) and can be deployed to GPUs

item.title: ML Notes on Learning and working with DNN
item.description: Deep learning: A brief walk into the foundations underlying neural networks and deep learning.

item.title: PhD Thesis Topic
item.description: Generating Networks by Learning Hyperedge Replacement Grammars

item.title: Welcome
item.description:
The purpose of this Web-site is to tell you about my research interests, the projects I am involved in, the things I make, and a little about who I am.
Connect with me via: LinkedIn | Twitter
